SEARCH
Package com.game.gui.scenes.game

Class GameView

java.lang.Object
com.game.gui.scenes.game.GameView
public class GameView extends Object
The GameView class creates and manages the game HUD, pause menu, and end game overlay. It handles rendering game elements, managing player controls, and responding to various events.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameView

      public GameView(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init()
      Initializes the game view by setting up the primary stage, creating the canvas, initializing the GUI components, and setting player controls.

    • render

      public void render(List<SceneTile> backgroundTiles, List<Spawner> spawners, List<Block> blocks, List<Entity> entities, List<SceneTile> overlayTiles, List<PlayerSpawner> playerSpawners)
      Renders the game elements on the canvas, including background tiles, spawners, blocks, entities, and overlay tiles. Also updates the player's HUD and current state.
      Parameters:
      backgroundTiles - A list of tiles representing the background layer.
      spawners - A list of spawners responsible for spawning entities in the scene.
      blocks - A list of blocks used as obstacles or interactable objects in the game.
      entities - A list of game entities to be drawn on the canvas.
      overlayTiles - A list of tiles representing the overlay (UI) layer.
      playerSpawners - A list of player spawners used for tracking kills and positions.

    • show

      public void show()
      Displays the primary stage of the game GUI and makes the window movable.

    • restart

      public void restart()
      Restarts the game by hiding the end game overlay and resetting player controls.

    • gameEnd

      public void gameEnd(PlayerSpawner winner)
      Displays the end game overlay with a label announcing the winner.
      Parameters:
      winner - The player spawner representing the winning player.

    • getPrimaryStage

      public javafx.stage.Stage getPrimaryStage()

    • setController

      public void setController(GameController controller)
